dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Bezos just dropped nearly a hundred million on homelessness. Big deal, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Bezos just dropped nearly a hundred million on homelessness. Big deal, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Tuesday, the Amazon founder ands CEO outlined his plans to give $97.5 million to two dozen nonprofits around the country that are providing services to the homeless.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, um, yeah, it's pretty significant. He's, like, giving out $97.5 million to 24 different nonprofits. From his Day One Fund.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, um, yeah, it's pretty significant. He's, like, giving out ninety seven point five dollars million to twenty four different nonprofits. From his Day One Fund.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Tuesday, the Amazon founder ands CEO outlined his plans to give $97.5 million to two dozen nonprofits around the country that are providing services to the homeless. This is the first round of giving that Bezos will conduct as part of his Day One Fund, announced in September...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Significant." Really? That's, what, less than a tenth of one percent of his, uh, current net worth? That's pocket change for him.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Significant. Really? That's, what, less than a tenth of one percent of his, uh, current net worth? That's pocket change for him.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He is currently worth $125 billion, according to Forbes real-time rankings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, it's still nearly a hundred million dollars going to, you know, aid the homeless. Emergency shelters, long-term solutions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, it's still nearly a hundred million dollars going to, you know, aid the homeless. Emergency shelters, long-term solutions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The nonprofits that will receive funding are located in places like San Francisco, Washington, D.C., and Omaha, where they operate emergency and short-term shelters and also help families move into permanent housing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and funny how a bunch of those recipients are, like, right where Amazon's setting up new headquarters, isn't it? Long Island City, northern Virginia... coincidence?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and funny how a bunch of those recipients are, like, right where Amazon's setting up new headquarters, isn't it? Long Island City, northern Virginia... coincidence?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: One recipient is the Urban Resource Institute in New York... Amazon announced last week that Long Island City would be the site of one of its additional headquarters. ... Another recipient is Northern Virginia Family Service, based in Oakton, Virginia, which will receive $2.5 million. Amazon is building its second new headquarters in nearby Crystal City, Virginia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: He, uh, he picked these organizations with a "diverse group of experts," apparently. They're trying to amplify efforts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He, uh, he picked these organizations with a diverse group of experts, apparently. They're trying to amplify efforts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a statement, Bezos said he worked with a dozen experts across the nonprofit and government sectors to decide which organizations to fund. ... The money will be used to help the organizations expand the scope and impact of their efforts, according to a statement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Amplify whose efforts? His own PR efforts? And get this, one place, Urban Resource Institute, is getting five million to train people for "sustainable energy and bio-tech." For the homeless. That's just... wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Amplify whose efforts? His own P R efforts? And get this, one place, Urban Resource Institute, is getting five million to train people for sustainable energy and bio-tech. For the homeless. That's just... wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: One recipient is the Urban Resource Institute in New York, which plans to use its $5 million grant to bolster the job training and placement it can provide to homeless families, with a focus on jobs that pay more than minimum wage or are increasingly in demand, in areas like coding.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But that's good, right? High-demand, high-paying fields. Giving them a, um, a future.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But that's good, right? High-demand, high-paying fields. Giving them a, um, a future.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...with a focus on jobs that pay more than minimum wage or are increasingly in demand, in areas like coding.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Or, or it's just, like, a way to make it sound good. Five million for job training? What percentage of those folks are actually gonna land bio-tech jobs, though? Be realistic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or, or it's just, like, a way to make it sound good. Five million for job training? What percentage of those folks are actually gonna land bio-tech jobs, though? Be realistic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's part of a bigger $2 billion commitment, remember? That's for the homeless and also those Montessori-inspired preschools.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's part of a bigger two dollars billion commitment, remember? That's for the homeless and also those Montessori-inspired preschools.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is the first round of giving that Bezos will conduct as part of his Day One Fund, announced in September, in which he pledged $2 billion to help homeless families and create Montessori-inspired preschools.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Montessori preschools. Because that's what, uh, truly addresses systemic homelessness. Right after he gave what, thirty-three million for DACA scholarships? Compared to, you know, his one hundred twenty-five billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Montessori preschools. Because that's what, uh, truly addresses systemic homelessness. Right after he gave what, thirty-three million for D A C A scholarships? Compared to, you know, his one hundred twenty-five billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The biggest gift was previously the $33 million he donated to fund college scholarships for 1,000 undocumented immigrant high school students who live in the U.S. with Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals, or DACA, status. ... He is currently worth $125 billion, according to Forbes real-time rankings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but he said the funds will be "utilized with the utmost wisdom and compassion." I mean, the organizations are getting, like, two and a half or five million each.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, but he said the funds will be utilized with the utmost wisdom and compassion. I mean, the organizations are getting, like, two and a half or five million each.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Congrats to the recipientswe know youll spend the money wisely and with heart, wrote Bezos in a tweet. ... Each organization will receive $2.5 million or $5 million from the Day 1 Families Fund.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Wisdom and compassion." From the guy who just lost thirty-five billion dollars in stock value. Makes ninety-seven million look a little less, uh, generous, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wisdom and compassion. From the guy who just lost thirty-five billion dollars in stock value. Makes ninety-seven million look a little less, uh, generous, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, due to a decline in the price of Amazon shares thats a $35 billion drop since we published The Forbes 400 list in early October.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's still a lot of money, though. The Urban Resource Institute president was "in a celebratory mood." They expect funds by late November.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's still a lot of money, though. The Urban Resource Institute president was in a celebratory mood. They expect funds by late November.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We're in celebratory mode. This is a significant grant, says Nathaniel Fields, president and CEO of Urban Resource Institute, who said they submitted a grant application just a few weeks ago and expect to receive the funds by the end of November.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Celebratory mood, sure. I'm sure Amazon is, uh, also in a "celebratory mood" over the positive headlines right before they, you know, muscle into new communities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Celebratory mood, sure. I'm sure Amazon is, uh, also in a celebratory mood over the positive headlines right before they, you know, muscle into new communities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, you're saying it's, like, purely self-serving?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, you're saying it's, like, purely self-serving?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, I'm just saying, it's an awful lot of conveniently placed "philanthropy" for the "visionary leader." That's all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, I'm just saying, it's an awful lot of conveniently placed philanthropy for the visionary leader. That's all.
